intro: Cymopterus ligusticoides, commonly known as the western yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces a distinctive, aromatic scent and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Cymopterus ligusticoides is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
